title: Thugs hacked woman’s hair off during ‘cruel’ interrogation over missing watch
text:
Patrick Sullivan and Michael Turner were each jailed for four years over the ‘cruel’ assault (Picture: Cleveland Police)

Two thugs who hacked a ‘vulnerable’ woman’s hair off with a machete during a ‘cruel’ six-hour interrogation about a missing watch have been jailed.

Patrick Sullivan and Michael Turner, both 37, laid into the woman after taking her to a house in Stockton-On-Tees.

The pair took turns waving the machete around before using it to remove her hair – even going so far as to use an electric razor to complete the degrading job.

Steroid-fuelled Turner then hit the woman’s wrists with the blade and used an axe to whack her knees.

Both admitted unlawful wounding and Judge Stephen Ashurst jailed each of them for four years at Teesside Crown Court following what he called ‘an extreme case of cruel violence’.

The court heard Patrick Sullivan ‘lost control of his temper’ after blaming the woman for stealing a watch featuring a picture of his dead son (Picture: Cleveland Police)

Michael Turner also took turns waving the machete around (Picture: Cleveland Police)

The court heard the men, both from Stockton, were convinced their victim had stolen Sullivan’s watch, which had a photo of his dead son on it.

‘That’s unfortunately why, on this occasion, he lost control of his temper,’ said his barrister James Bourne-Arton.

In a harrowing victim impact statement, the woman described being tortured by ‘flashbacks’ and ‘nightmares which will not go away’ since the attack.

‘I thought I was going to die,’ she wrote.

‘I honestly believe that he men would hurt me so badly that I wouldn’t get out alive.’

The court heard she has been left with permanent scarring to her hand and both of her legs and her hair has yet to fully grow back.
